decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a combination of instant reanimation spells such as Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand into play from the graveyard. Fallaji Archaeologists and Tainted Indulgence provide additional ways to reanimate creatures, while cards like Thoughtseize and Grief help disrupt the opponent's game plan. Atraxa, Grand Unifier provides additional value by proliferating counters and Priest of Fell Rites helps with card advantage. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to dominate the game. The key concept lies in using The One Ring as a win condition, providing a source of continual advantage and pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes a mixture of versatile spells and creatures to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By carefully managing resources and leveraging the unique abilities of The One Ring, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in order to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and put into play using cards like Chord of Calling and Urza's Saga. The key strategy is to use these creatures to combo off and win the game quickly. The deck includes various utility creatures like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Springheart Nantuko, as well as protection cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Endurance. The goal is to efficiently search for the right creatures at the right time and overwhelm the opponent with powerful combos.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with unique abilities to create a powerful toolbox of options. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact, the deck can search for specific creatures needed in any given situation. The inclusion of cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Nadu, Winged Wisdom provide additional value and flexibility to the combo potential of the deck. The lands in the deck also provide a diverse range of mana options to support the many different creatures and abilities within the deck.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creature plays combined with burn spells for direct damage. The deck also utilizes artifacts like Unstable Amulet and The One Ring for additional damage output. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck's mana base. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with quick creatures and efficient removal, aiming to quickly reduce their life total to zero before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on aggressively lowering the player's life total to capitalize on the power of Death's Shadow while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and hand disruption. The inclusion of control elements like Counterspell and Fatal Push adds versatility and allows the deck to adapt to different matchups. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and card selection, while Murktide Regent serves as a resilient threat that can quickly close out games. The deck aims to control the board and protect its key threats while applying pressure to the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells. It utilizes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state, while also utilizing Trinisphere and Karn, the Great Creator to control the game. The deck's win condition comes from overwhelming the opponent with big threats like Kozilek, the Broken Reality and All Is Dust, backed up by efficient mana acceleration and card draw.

This deck aims to control the game through the use of powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells while assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere are used to hinder the opponent's game plan, while Karn, the Great Creator provides access to artifacts that can further disrupt the opponent or provide additional win conditions. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and lock them out of the game with disruptive elements.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggression, utilizing a wide range of creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional flexibility in casting spells. The deck emphasizes powerful creature cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt. Tribal Flames and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional utility and damage potential. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse color requirements of the deck's spells.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creature plays and disruption spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tarmogoyf alongside removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, as well as versatile cards like Kolaghan's Command, the deck aims to control the game while dealing consistent damage. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Wrenn and Six provides additional value and card advantage to maintain the aggression.

This deck focuses on using a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal significant damage. The deck includes strong creatures like Guide of Souls and Orcish Bowmasters, along with powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Sorin of House Markov. The goal is to control the battlefield with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize while also applying pressure with fast, efficient creatures. The deck is designed to win the game quickly through a combination of creature attacks and burn spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent by removing threats with cards like Fatal Push, Fell the Profane, and Grief, while also disrupting their hand with Thoughtseize. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Necrodominance and Phyrexian Tower to bring out powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also has ways to recur creatures from the graveyard with cards like Malakir Rebirth. Overall, it's a strategic and disruptive deck that aims to out value and outlast the opponent in a battle of attrition.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient threats like Nethergoyf and Dauthi Voidwalker early while disrupting the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize. Mishra's Bauble helps to control the top of the deck while cards like Fatal Push and Not Dead After All handle opposing creatures. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts like Shadowspear or Nihil Spellbomb. With a mix of aggressive creatures, disruption, and card advantage, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. The goal is to chain together spells to create a storm of spells to overwhelm the opponent. This is done by utilizing cards like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible to draw through the deck and find key combo pieces. The deck also includes interaction with cards like Wish and Strike It Rich to find specific cards when needed. It aims to win through a fast and explosive combo finish.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with the Urza lands (Mine, Tower, Power Plant) to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also utilizes control elements such as All Is Dust and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Expedition Map helps to search for key lands while The One Ring boosts the power of the Eldrazi creatures. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with massive threats.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring and a mix of creatures like Nishoba Brawler, Wild Nacatl, and Scion of Draco, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. With a strong removal suite including Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, along with pump spells like Tribal Flames, the deck can often push through the opponent's defenses and secure a victory. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements for its spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards that tax their resources. By using cards like Archon of Emeria and Leonin Arbiter, the deck can slow down the opponent's mana development while applying pressure with creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and White Orchid Phantom. The deck also includes removal spells like Solitude and Demolition Field to deal with threats. The goal is to create a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy, leading to a swift victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through various means such as counterspells, removal spells, and stax effects, while using Eldrazi creatures to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, prevent them from developing a board presence, and eventually overwhelm them with powerful Eldrazi creatures. By combining control elements with Eldrazi threats, this deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game, ultimately emerging victorious through its versatile and resilient strategy.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Control deck is to utilize powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana quickly. By using cards like Through the Breach to cheat out big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its high-powered threats. The deck also includes control spells like Kozilek's Command and All Is Dust to manage the board and protect its own creatures. With a mix of ramp, control, and big threats, this deck aims to dominate the late game.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful equipment combo that can quickly turn a small creature into a huge threat. By using cards like Puresteel Paladin and Sigarda's Aid to cheat Colossus Hammer into play and equipping it to a creature, you can deal massive damage in just a few turns. The deck also includes ways to protect your creatures, like Giver of Runes and Shadowspear, as well as ways to search for key pieces with Stoneforge Mystic and Urza's Saga. This aggressive strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can mount a defense.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board until it can establish a dominant position. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo to generate card advantage and incremental value. It uses a mix of burn spells, creature removal, and versatile spells to handle a variety of threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also providing flexibility and consistency.

This deck focuses on cycling through creatures with different abilities to set up for a powerful Living End combo. By cycling through their deck, the player can disrupt their opponent's strategy with cards like Grief and Subtlety while also setting up a board state that can overwhelm their opponent with powerful creatures when Living End is cast. Through a combination of card draw, disruption, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to control the game and secure a victory through the Living End combo.

This aggressive Red Deck Wins archetype focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a combination of burn spells, efficient creatures, and card advantage. With cards like Lightning Bolt and Dragon's Rage Channeler providing direct damage, Mishra's Bauble and Underworld Breach allowing for card recursion, and creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off pressuring the opponent, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent early and finish the game swiftly. The inclusion of cards like Mutagenic Growth and Galvanic Discharge adds versatility and reach to this fast-paced deck.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and medallions, using Ral, Monsoon Mage to deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes the Storm mechanic to cast multiple spells in a turn, with Past in Flames allowing for recursion of key spells from the graveyard. Wish allows for flexibility in accessing sideboard options. The deck focuses on a fast and explosive playstyle, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with a large storm count and finish the game with cards like Grapeshot.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana through rituals and Medallion effects while casting spells like Glimpse the Impossible and Sundering Eruption to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes Ral, Monsoon Mage to draw cards and Past in Flames to recast spells from the graveyard for additional impact. Wish allows for flexibility in accessing key cards from outside the main deck. Overall, the goal is to assemble the combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful storm sequence.

This deck focuses on using cards like Hedron Crab and Ruin Crab to mill the opponent's deck while controlling the game with counterspells and removal spells. By maximizing the opponent's graveyard with Archive Trap and Surgical Extraction, the deck can take advantage of cards like Visions of Beyond and Fractured Sanity to draw cards and further mill the opponent. Tasha's Hideous Laughter serves as a game-ending finisher, while Jace, the Perfected Mind provides additional card advantage and control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with mill while disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the board through counterspells and removal, while also utilizing card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a mix of counter magic and removal spells, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Murktide Regent. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently answering threats and generating card advantage, eventually overwhelming them with powerful spells like Subtlety and Flame of Anor. By controlling the game tempo and resource advantage, the deck aims to secure victory.
